Voting Gauntlet:

Hero's army for a set period

Battle Format:

・Your leader
・A friend, if you have friends
registered
・A player you have not

The more you use, the more

Inheriting Skills:
An ally can inherit up to three
skills at a time from another
ally. You'll lose the ally
donating any skills.

Inherited skills are added to
the recipient's skill list. They
are learned like any other skill
but require 1.5x the usual SP.

Note that any ally marked as a
favorite can't be used as a
source for inheriting skills.

To remove a favorite mark,
hold down on the ally's icon
and then tap the favorite mark
on the ally's profile screen.

maps in a set. (Duplicate Heroes
cannot be used later either.)

get a game over, all Heroes will
be released.

results have been calculated but

Ally Support:
Allies can create bonds by
forming partnerships with one
another.

When partners fight near each
other, they'll gain an advantage
on the battlefield.

Creating Bonds:
Create a bond by selecting two
allies to become partners.

Their Support Rank will start at C.

Increasing Support Ranks:
If partners are within at least two
spaces of each other and battle
foes level 35 or higher, their bond
will grow stronger.

Their Support Rank will increase
once their bond grows strong
enough. The possible ranks are C,
B, A, and S.

Support Effects 1:
Partners at Support Rank C or
higher will gain a stat boost when
they fight right next to each other.

C: Res+2
B: Def/Res+2
A: Spd/Def/Res+2
S: Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2

Support Effects 2:
Partners will also receive a stat
boost when there's one space
between them, but the boost
will not be as strong.

C: Res+1
B: Def/Res+1
A: Spd/Def/Res+1
S: Atk/Spd/Def/Res+1

Ally Support Limits:
Each ally can have only one
partner at a time. It is possible
to change an ally's partner, but
doing so will reset the Support
Rank with their current partner.

Summoner Support:
As the Summoner, you can
choose an ally to form a bond
with.

The ally you choose to support
will gain a stat boost.

Forming a Bond:
Select an ally to support to start
forming your bond.

Your Support Rank will start at C.

Increasing Support Rank:
When your chosen ally battles
foes level 35 or higher, the bond
between you and the ally will
grow stronger.

Your Support Rank will increase
once your bond grows strong
enough. The possible ranks are
C, B, A, and S.

Summoner Support Effects:
When your Support Rank is C or
higher, your chosen ally will
receive a persistent stat boost.

C: HP+3, Res+2
B: HP+4, Def/Res+2
A: HP+4, Spd/Def/Res+2
S: HP+5, Atk/Spd/Def/Res+2

Summoner Support Limits:
You can support only one ally at
a time. It is possible to change
which ally you're supporting, but
doing so will reset the Support
Rank with your current ally.

Midgard's Shield is Thórr's target.
Don't let your Gateways fall!

Defending Midgard's Shield:
Place Shield-exclusive structures
and allies to fortify the Shield.

Using Mechanism Structures:
During battle, tap a mechanism,
and then tap the activation button
on the lower part of the screen to
activate its special effect.

Afterward, the effect will refresh
after a certain number of turns.

Permanent Structures:
Your key structures, Gateways,
cannot be removed.

Structure Destruction:
Gateways can be destroyed
with a single attack. Mechanisms
cannot be destroyed.

Auto Setup:
You can use this function to both
automatically build, place, and
improve structures, as well as
create and place teams.
Note: Midgard Gems will be used
as necessary to build or improve
your structures.

Test Defenses:
Test your map's defenses and
your team's mettle.

Edit Mjölnir's Strike Team:
Up to four ally Pair Up units can
be formed for Mjölnir's Strike.

Allies paired up for Mjölnir's
Strike will not receive stat boosts
from their partner, but if the lead
is defeated, the cohort will remain.

Team Lock:
All members' current levels, stats,
skills, Sacred Seals, and blessings
will be locked, but only in the
Mjölnir's Strike battles. Unlocking
the team will allow any changes to
the units to be reflected.

The Four Roles:
Teams are made up of four roles.

Atk roles move within the top 3
map rows and are not attacked
by foes.

Spd roles gain Spd+10 and move
within the bottom 5 map rows.

Def roles gain Def+10 and move
within the bottom 5 map rows.

Res roles gain Res+10 and move
within the bottom 5 map rows.

Bonus Seasons:
Mythic Heroes deployed during
their bonus season are granted
one of two bonuses:

Major: +4 to HP and all stats
Minor: +2 to HP and all stats

Mythic Hero Score Boost:
The level of Mythic Heroes
deployed in their bonus season
will be treated as if they have
additional merges. (Major, +10
merges; Minor, +5 merges.)

Then, stronger foes will appear,
offering higher potential scores.

More Information:
Legendary and Mythic Effects
that boost blessed allies do not
activate in Mjölnir's Strike.

EXP, SP, HM, etc. will not be
earned for Mjölnir's Strike.

Place/Remove Structures:
Place or remove the structures
that you've finished building.

Structure Limit:
You can place only a certain
number of each type of structure.

How to Use Mechanisms:
・ In battle, select a mechanism
structure by tapping on it.
↓
・ Tap on the activation button in
the lower part of the screen.

Build Structures:
Use Midgard Gems to build new
structures.

Improve Structures:
Use Midgard Gems to improve
structures by one level.

How to Use Mechanisms:
・ In battle, select a mechanism
structure by tapping on it.
↓
・ Tap on the activation button in

Flow of Mjölnir's Strike:
1. Brace phase. Ready defenses
and edit Midgard's Shield.
2. Shield phase. Weather the foe's
onslaught to gain offensive power.
3. Counter phase. Deal damage to
the foe using your gained power.
Deal more than you take to win!

Brace Phase:
This is when battle preparations
take place.

Build/improve structures and
place allies on the map via the
Edit Shield Map screen.

Shield Phase:
Weather the onslaught. Last for
seven turns to claim victory. Try
as many times as you want.

Losing an ally or Gateway lowers
your score. If both Gateways fall,
you lose the battle.

Strength of Thórr's Forces:
Foe strength is based on Tier,
difficulty, and the strength of the
Heroes on your defensive team.

The strength of a Pair Up unit in
Mjölnir's Strike is determined by
the stronger of the two Heroes.

Score:
Your score will be based on the
strength of your defeated foes.

Rewards:
After the event, you earn rewards
based on your Tier. High scores
can lead to a Tier promotion.

Bonus Seasons:
Mythic Heroes deployed during
their bonus season are granted
one of two bonuses:

Major: +4 to HP and all stats
Minor: +2 to HP and all stats

Mythic Hero Score Boost:
The level of Mythic Heroes
deployed in their bonus season
will be treated as if they have
additional merges. (Major, +10
merges; Minor, +5 merges.)

Then, stronger foes will appear,
offering higher potential scores.

Bonus Structure:
When placed, all deployed allies
are granted Atk/Spd/Def/Res+4.
(This will not affect your foe's
strength or score value.)

Counter Phase:
All players join forces to protect
the Kingdom of Askr, battling back
against Thórr's forces.

Victory Condition:
If Askr's forces deal more damage
than Thórr's forces before time
runs out, Askr will be declared
the winner!

Countering:
Use Counter Arrows to Counter.
Your offensive power increases
based on how many you use. (Any
left unused do not carry over.)

Offensive Power:
Based on Tier and Shield score.

Weaker Bonus:
When weaker than your foes, your
offensive power is multiplied by 5.

Combo Bonus:
Based on the number of Counter
Arrows used across all players in
the hour prior. (Details follow.)

Create combos to increase the
overall damage dealt every hour!
1,000+ combo: ×1.1 bonus
2,000+ combo: ×1.2 bonus
3,000+ combo: ×1.3 bonus
4,000+ combo: ×1.4 bonus
5,000+ combo: ×1.5 bonus

Askr Level:
・ Increases by 1 when you win.
If your force was stronger than
your foe's for a total of ten hours
or more, increases by 2 instead.
・ Decreases by 1 when you lose.
・ The higher the Askr Level, the
better the rewards.

Compiling Combat Manuals:
You can use Divine Codes to
compile Combat Manuals.

There are two types of Combat
Manuals that can be compiled,
Normal and Limited-Time.

Limited-Time Combat Manuals:
Divine Code: Ephemera items are
used to compile Combat Manuals
within a limited time frame. After
time is up, such codes are lost.
(Ephemera can be obtained from
various sources and events.)

Normal Combat Manuals:
Divine Code: Part X items can be
used to compile Combat Manuals.
They can be obtained from
sources like Mjölnir's Strike, the
Arena, and Aether Raids.

Ordered Compiling:
Normal Combat Manuals must be
completed and unlocked in order,
starting with the leftmost manual.

Once the leftmost manual has
been compiled, the next can be
compiled (proceeding right).

Frontline Phalanx:
All players cooperate to fight
armies lead by a boss. Players
deploy support forces to aid the
Heroes fighting the foes head-on.

Once the boss has been defeated,
the event is cleared.

Round:
Each round, Heroes fight their
foes. The more support forces
you deploy, the more foes they
will have to fight against. Fighting
more foes earns a higher score on
victory, but the chance of failure
increases as well.

Score:
Score is calculated by multiplying
the support forces you deployed
by the boost value. Victory will
increase the boost, but Defeat
reduces it to 1.0. Triumph will
double the score, and a Total
Loss will reduce it by half.

Guardian Shield:
A Guardian Shield can be used
in a round where support forces
are deployed. When used, you will
earn a victorious score even if you
would otherwise be defeated. On
top of that, a bonus will be added
to the score. Usable up to 3 times.

Skjaldborg:
If a lot of players use Guardian
Shields in the same round, the
Skjaldborg will activate. If it does,
the Hero will be protected from
defeat. Also, a further bonus will
be added to the score.

Boss Rewards:
Earn rewards by defeating the
boss. The reward can be earned
even without deploying forces.

Rank Rewards:
After the event, you will receive
rewards based on your ranking.

Support Rewards:
Rewards can be earned once per
day by deploying support forces.

If some daily rewards are not
available due to the boss being
defeated quickly, they will be
distributed as Boss Rewards.

Pawns of Loki:
A game in a world of Loki's
design. Forma in the shape of
your allied Heroes are used as
pieces in a board game! Use your
personal approach and face your
opponent—with no stamina limit,
you can play as much as you like.

Phases of the Game:
・ Setup Phase (Draft Forma)
   ↓
・ Battle Phase (Battle foes)

The game will end after a set
number of turns. The side with
the highest score wins.

Setup Phase:
・ Every turn, you will receive an
allotment of war funds. Use the
war funds to draft Forma.
・ Unused war funds carry over.
・ Forma you can draft are drawn
randomly from the Heroes who
make up your brigade.

Setup Phase - Discharging:
・ Forma units that are no longer
needed can be discharged.
・ The first time you discharge
a unit each turn, you will gain
that unit's worth in war funds.
After that, the amount returned
will be half the unit's worth.

Battle Phase:
・ Battles play out automatically.
・ Forma in the front act before
those in the back.
・ Forma act in order of level,
highest first. Within each level,
order is determined by Spd.
・ Forma will attack nearest foe.

Battle Phase - Results:
The winner is determined by
comparing your team's HP after
damage to the foe's team's HP
after damage. If your team's value
is higher, you win! The greater the
difference, the more you score!

Bonus Weapon Type:
・ Each round, if you have Forma
with a weapon that matches the
bonus (Physical attacks, Range=1,
etc.), you will get a score bonus.

of your team or more is made up
of bonus-type Forma.

Level Up with Trio Forma:
Draft three of the same Forma
unit onto your team, and they will
merge to create a strong Trio
Forma unit that's 10 levels higher.
(Draft cost for that Forma will be
+2 afterward.) Also, all Forma in
shop and on team get 2 levels.

Building Combos:
If your team's makeup meets
certain conditions, you will earn
a combo point. Each combo point
increases HP and stats by 1 for
every Forma on your team while
in Battle Phase. (See the Help
messages for more on combos.)

High Score and Tier:
・ After each round, your high
score determines your tier for
the next round.
・ Beyond earning you better
rewards, raising your tier will
add more turns to the game.
・ Tiers are kept between rounds.

Score and Cumulative Points:
・ Your score from each game
adds to your cumulative points,
which determines your rewards.

First Daily Game, Triple Points:
・ The points you earn from your
first game each day will be tripled.

Relief Funds:
If you lose two or more battles in
a row, you will get a 1.5x boost to
your war funds during the next
Setup Phase.

Ascended Heroes:
Ascended Heroes can receive
a single Ascended Asset.

Non-Ascended Heroes:
Heroes besides Ascended Heroes
can also consume an Ascendant
Floret to use Ascend Traits once.

Arena Effects:
Increases from Ascended Assets
do not change how the Hero's
stats are treated during opponent
selection in modes like Arena.

Ascended Flaws:
Using Ascend Traits on a Hero's
flaw trait will cancel out that flaw.
(If a flaw is canceled by a merge,
the Ascended Asset will remain in
effect as normal.)

Heroes with No Flaw:
If a stat increase from a merge
would raise a stat that has already
been increased by an Ascended
Asset, the stat increase from the
merge will be applied to a
different stat instead.

Merge Allies Effects:
When merging allies, if the source
ally has an Ascended Asset that
matches the target ally's normal
asset (and the target ally does not
already have an Ascended Asset),
then the Ascended Asset will be
applied to a different stat instead.

Using Trait Fruit:
If you give a Hero a Trait Fruit
after granting them an Ascended
Asset, it is possible to change both
their asset and Ascendant Asset.

Favored Heroes:
Select a Hero to be your captain,
raise their Favor, and battle!

Win or lose, you can raise your
Favor Level and earn rewards.

Favor Level:
・Win: gain 10 points

・Win or lose:
KO Score and Capture Score add
to the total. Maximum of 10
points added. Read on for more
details.

Winning Conditions:
・Defeat all foes within five turns.
・Survive five turns and earn the
higher score.

Move Order:
・After you perform an action,
your opponent will be able to.
・Using a Duo or Harmonized Skill
counts as an action. They can be
used by only one Hero per turn.
・If neither team has a remaining
action they can use, the next
turn will begin.

Move Order, Continued:
If an action remains, you can still
use a Duo or Harmonized skill
even if all Heroes have moved.

(If all Heroes have performed an
action and no Duo or Harmonized
Skills can be used, the turn will
end even if actions remain.)

Move Order, Continued:
The player with the most actions
remaining at the end of a turn
will move first on the next turn.

If the number of actions remaining
is equal, the move order will not
change from the prior turn.

Range-1 Bonus:
If a Hero with a range of 1 is in
combat with a Hero with a range
of 2, they will gain Def/Res+7.
Notes: This includes area-of-
effect Specials. This bonus will
not apply if your unit uses Savior.

Earning KO Score:
・Defeat a foe: +2
・Defeat a foe using a captain: +1
・Defeat opponent's captain: +1

Example: Your captain defeats
your opponent's captain.
2+1+1=4.

Capture Score:
At the end of each turn, if the
number of Heroes on your team
occupying the Capture Area in the
center of the map is at least two
more than your opponent's, you'll
earn two points.

Free Duel:
Does not affect Favor Levels.
Battle codes and custom rules
can be set. Battle the way you
want to.

Battle codes:
If you set a battle code, you will
be matched only with opponents
who set the same battle code.

Custom Rules:
You can choose to set the rules
yourself or leave them to your
opponent.

If you set the rules, you will be
matched only with opponents
who set the same rules, or those
who leave it up to their opponent.

Practice Duel:
Does not affect Favor Levels.
Custom Rules can be set.

Instead of a live opponent, you
will battle an auto-generated
team.

Win Count Limit:
There is a limit to the number of
tracked wins. (This limit is subject
to change in the future.)

Quests:
Battles fought in Summoner Duels
will not progress quests.

Disconnections:
Disconnecting in the middle of a
match may be treated as forfeiting
and be counted as a loss.

Turns:
A turn consists of action phases
taken by both sides, not just one
player. Skills with "During unit's
first combat in player phase or
enemy phase" trigger their effects
only once, during the turn's
first combat.

Settings:
Your usual settings may be
overwritten by settings specific
to Summoner Duels.

Edit Duels Team:
This option allows you to
create a team for use in
Summoner Duels.

Team Creation:
・A team comprises five Heroes.
・Duplicate Heroes are not allowed.
・You can include only one ally
that can use Sing or Dance
on your team.
・You can include only one ally
that can use Savior.

Blessings:
In Summoner Duels, Heroes other
than Legendary or Mythic Heroes
may receive Legendary Effects
regardless of whether they have
a blessing.

Pair Up:
Pair Up cannot be used when
playing Summoner Duels.

Legendary Heroes with Pair Up
will receive stat bonuses only
when their season is active.

Captain Skills:
When creating a team, you can
set a Captain Skill.

If your captain is defeated, the
Captain Skill's effect will no
longer be granted.

Tap Battle:
This is an action game where you
tap the screen to defeat enemies.

Please try playing with the music
and character voices on.

How to Play:
Tap the Summoner at the bottom
of the screen to attack. If your
timing is just right, enemies
will be hit with a critical attack
and fly off-screen. You can rack
up a combo by landing multiple
critical attacks in a row.
In expert mode, tap the rows!

Expert Mode:
In casual mode, you tap the
Summoner at the bottom of the
screen. There is also an expert
mode where you can tap each
ally's row to make them attack.

Playable Stages:
Not all stages will be available
immediately after the event
begins.

Once a set amount of time has
passed, new stages will become
playable.

Tap Battle Settings:
If you feel the timing isn't quite
right, try adjusting your settings.

You might find it's easier to
play if you adjust the input timing
or turn the sound effects and
voices off.

Tap Battle Settings:
Adjust your settings to make the
game more enjoyable to play.

If you feel that your input timing
isn't quite right, try adjusting
the timing settings here.

Adjust Timing:
You can adjust the input timing
by tapping in time with the beat.
After that, if you feel the timing
isn't quite right, you can make
manual adjustments. Raise the
value if it's too fast, or lower it if
it's too slow.

Sound Effects and Voice:
You can also disable the
sound effects or character
voices. Turning sounds on
and off in Tap Battle Settings
applies only to Tap Battles.

Edit Brigades:
A brigade is the team you use in
Rival Domains.
You can choose up to 20 allies
from your army or your friends'.
Any empty slots will automatically
be filled with reinforcements.

Brigade Limits:
・ You can include only one ally
who can use the abilities Sing or
Dance within your brigade.
・ Your brigade may not contain
duplicate Heroes.

Rules for Rival Domains:
・ The battle won't end even if
one side's forces are depleted—
fresh troops will continue the fight.
・ The battle will end after 10 turns
have passed or one side's
fortress is destroyed.
・ You will not earn EXP or SP.
・ Reinforcements will not gain
boosts from Legendary Effects.

About Fortresses:
・ It takes three hits to destroy a
fortress.
・ You can warp to a fortress you
control.
・ Allies in a fortress recover 10
HP per turn.
・ Fortresses are considered
defensive terrain.

About Camps:
・ It takes two hits to defeat a
camp. It then becomes yours.
・ You can warp to a camp you
control.
・ Allies in a camp recover 10
HP per turn.
・ Camps are considered
defensive terrain.

Warping:
Allies adjacent to a fortress or
camp they control can instantly
warp to a space adjacent to
another fortress or camp they
control.

Rival Domains Scoring:
You'll receive a score after
the battle has ended.

You can earn a higher score
by protecting your fortress and
camps while defeating foes and
capturing the enemy's fortress.

Grand Conquests:
In Grand Conquests, three armies
battle to conquer territory across
a continent.

When the battle ends, the armies
will earn rewards. The more
areas a team controls, the better
the rewards!

How to Participate:
Select an area that is adjacent to
an enemy to enter battle and earn
points. Entering battle consumes
Grand Conquests-specific
stamina. Use the boost option to
consume more stamina and
multiply your score!

Score Effects:
After you battle, you'll earn a
score. Points will be added to
your army's total in the area
you've selected.

Controlling Areas:
・The army that controls an area
at the beginning of a round will
accrue points.
・The army with the most points
at the end of a round will gain
control of that area.

Cooperation Bonus:
During each round, bonus points
will be applied to the total points
earned in an area, based on the
number of allies who battle in the
area during the round.

Helping Out:
・You can help out once per
round.
・Helping out boosts the number
of allies battling in a randomly
selected area by 1, which helps
boost the cooperation bonus.
You might also randomly gain
an item.

Getting Knocked Out:
・Armies can be knocked out
mid-round when battle conditions
are calculated. If the difference
between first and second place
armies exceeds the threshold,
the winner gains the area
immediately.
・If this happens, no battles can
be fought in the area for the
remainder of the round.

GC Tiers:
・Your GC Tier will increase
based on your cumulative score
in battle.
・The higher your GC Tier is, the
more points get added to areas
adjacent to your selected area.
・You can also earn other
rewards based on your GC Tier.

$aYour GC Tier has increased from

Rules for Rival Domains:
・ The battle won't end even if
one side's forces are depleted—
fresh troops will continue the fight.
・ The battle will end after 10 turns
have passed or one side's
fortress is destroyed.

More Rules for Rival Domains:
・Legendary Effects will not
trigger for reinforcements.
・You cannot earn EXP or SP.
・Bonds from ally support or
summoner support will not
grow stronger.

Battles:
After a victory, you won't be able
to battle again in support of your
Hero's army for a set period
of time.

How Scoring Works:
If you win, you'll earn points
based on the strength of your foe.
During a winning streak, you'll get
a chain bonus. This bonus resets
after your fifth straight win.

Rewards:
After the season ends, you'll get
rewards based on your tier.

If your score is high enough,
your Arena tier may go up.

Bonus Character Stat Boost:
When bonus characters are used
within the Arena, they'll be
granted HP+10 and Atk/Spd/
Def/Res+4.

This stat boost does not affect
the scores for foes you are
matched with. It also does not
apply to your defensive team.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards that
will be given out for the current
season. Change the filter to see
rewards given for your defense
and rank.

Defense Rewards:
These rewards are based on the
score your team has earned
for defense.

Speed:

After two turns, new allies arrive!

Relay Defense:
・ From a brigade of 20 total
allies, five will join the battle.
・ On turns 3, 5, and 7, your
current team of five will exit the
battlefield and five new allies will
enter.
・ The battle ends on turn 8 or
if your fortress is destroyed.

About Fortresses:
・ It takes three hits to destroy a
fortress.
・ You can warp to a fortress you
control.
・ Allies in your fortress recover
10 HP at start of turn.
・ Fortresses are considered
defensive terrain.

About Camps:
・ It takes two hits to defeat a
camp.
・ You can warp to a camp you
control.
・ Allies in a camp recover 10
HP at start of turn.
・ Camps are considered
defensive terrain.

Warping:
Allies adjacent to a fortress or
camp you control can instantly
warp to a space adjacent to
another fortress or camp you
control.

Relay Defense Scoring:
You'll receive a score after
the battle has ended.

You can earn a higher score
by protecting your fortress and
camps while helping your allies
survive until they rotate out.

More Rules for Relay Defense:
・ Enemy reinforcements will
appear.
・ Hero Merit cannot be earned.

The offense map is used when
attacking a foe's Aether Keep.

The defense map is for when you
need to defend your Aether Keep.

Fortifying Your Aether Keep:
Place structures and allies to
fortify your offense and defense
maps.

Defense Map:
Place defensive structures, traps,
resources, ornaments, and allies.

Defensive Team:
You can place your defensive
team in the top two rows of your
defense map.

Offense Map:
Place offensive structures.

Raiding Party:
The raiding party will be placed
one row above the offense map.

Placing Defensive Structures:
Defensive structures, resources,
traps, and ornaments can be
placed in any open space other
than special terrain (forests,
trenches, etc.).

Permanent Structures:
Fortresses and resources cannot
be removed.

Destroying Structures:
Fortresses cannot be destroyed.
Other structures can be
destroyed with a single attack.

Auto Setup:
You can use this function to both
automatically build, place, and
improve structures at your
choosing, as well as create and
place defensive teams. Note:
Aether Stones and Heavenly Dew
will be consumed as required to
create or strengthen structures.

Test Defense:
Test your defense map's defenses
and your defensive team's mettle
without consuming Aether.

Testing Outside the Season:
After a season ends but before
the next season begins, Test
Defenses is treated as part
of the next season.

Place/Remove Structures:
Place and remove the structures
you've finished building.

Structure Limit:
You can place only a certain
number of each type of structure.

Build Structures:
Use Aether Stones and Heavenly
Dew to build new structures.

Improve Structures:
Use Aether Stones and Heavenly
Dew to improve structures by
one level.

Limited-Time Structures:
Some structures are available to
build for a limited time. To build
them, you'll need items obtainable
only during a set time period.
Once created, however, the
structures are yours to keep.

Terrain:
Change the terrain of your Aether
Keep.

Some terrain requires Aether
Stones to unlock.

Aether Raids:
Place structures, a defensive
team, and more on your maps,
and then attack or defend to
increase your Lift.

If the defender is defeated within
seven turns, the attacker wins.

Aether:
This is used to take part in Aether
Raids. It's replenished by a fixed
amount once a day. It is totally
replenished at the start of a new
season.
Note: It cannot be replenished
beyond the maximum amount.
The higher your Lift, the more
Aether you'll need to battle.

Lift and Tier:
・ Your Lift will change based on
your attack and defense results.
・ Your Tier is based on your Lift.
・ When a new season begins, you
will start the season with an
amount of Lift based on your Tier
(beginning from AR Tier 12.)

Acquiring Lift:
・ Putting a bonus character in
your raiding party will give you a
+20 bonus to Lift.
・ The defensive side's maximum
Lift will not be reduced.
・ If you have multiple bonus
characters, only the single highest
bonus value is applied.
・ If your raiding party is defeated,
you will acquire less Lift.

Special Conditions:
If your Lift is 4,000 or lower, a
failed attack or defense will not
lower your total Lift.

Additional Information:
If a battle does not end properly,
neither the attacker nor the
defender will see a change in
their total Lift.

Bonus Characters Stat Boost:
When bonus characters are used
in Aether Raids, they'll be granted
HP+10 and Atk/Spd/Def/Res+4.
The amount of EXP and SP they
gain will be doubled.

Bonus Structures:
Place bonus structures in your
Aether Keep to increase the
Fortress (O) or Fortress (D) by
one level.

Fortress (D) and Tier Demotion:
If you're demoted to a lower Tier,
the level of your Fortress (D) will
be lowered.

Checking Rewards:
You can check the rewards you
can earn for the current season.

Receiving Rewards:
You can receive Aether Raids
rewards earned in the previous
season by entering Aether Raids
after that season's results have
been calculated but before the
current season ends.

Defense Results:
This list shows your defense
results for Aether Raids. You can
see how much Lift you earned
for each win and loss, as well as
the number of foes defeated.

Replay:
This lets you watch past defensive
battles against opponents.

Rematch:
You can attack an opponent that
defeated your defenses one time.
This will consume Aether. If the
same opponent appears on your
list multiple times, you can only
challenge them to a rematch once.

Lift Decrease Limit:
If you're attacked once, for the
next 20 hours, your Lift will not
decrease even if your defense
fails.

Rank:
This is your current rank.
Note that it may take time
for updated placement
information to be reflected.

Your Rank and Top Players:
These options show player
rankings for the current season.

Friends:
This option shows your friends'
rankings for the current season
and past seasons.

will be locked, but only for Aether
Raids defense battles. Unlocking

recent changes to the units to be

Increasing Defensive Team Size:
You can increase the size of your
defensive team if you raise your
AR Tier. You can get up to six
unit slots total. Aether Stones are
required to unlock additional slots.

Additional Unit Slot Conditions:
To get a 5th slot, you must reach
Tier 11 or higher. To get a 6th
slot, you must reach Tier 19 or
higher. If your Tier declines, you
will not be able to deploy units in
these slots. Regaining your Tier
will make them deployable again.

the defensive team, level 40
Alfonse, Sharena, and Anna will
defend in place of other units.

Tempest Trials:
In this mode, you'll battle through
multiple maps in a row. After
you clear one, the next will
appear immediately. Your allies
will not gain HP between battles.

Your goal: clear all of the maps!

Changing Teams:
If all of the allies you start with
are defeated, you can choose
a new set of allies and try again.

However, it's game over if you
lose too many battles!

About Your Score:
Your score is based on how well
you battled through a set of
maps.

Rewards are based on the
cumulative score earned during
the event period.

Bonus Allies:
If you include a bonus ally on your
team, you can increase your
score.

If you add multiple bonus allies,
only the highest bonus will apply.
Bonuses do not stack.

Check Rewards:
You can select Check Rewards if
you want to see the current
rewards.

Use the score options to view
rewards based on score or rank.

Rewards by Score:
You can view the rewards
for this event based on
your cumulative score.

Rewards by Rank:
You can view the rewards
based on rank. The top 500,000
scores are ranked.

Note that it may take some
time to reflect changes after the
calculations begin.

Receiving Rewards:
If you clear the score goal, you'll
qualify for a cumulative reward.
If earned, you can receive rank
rewards by entering Tempest
Trials after results have been
calculated but before the current
season ends.

Conferring Blessings:
Use Blessing items to confer
blessings on your allies.

Blessings cannot be conferred on
Legendary Heroes like Fjorm or
Mythic Heroes like Eir.

Blessing Effects #1:
Blessed allies receive double
the usual amount of SP and EXP
during battles.

Please note that while blessings
cannot be conferred on
Legendary Heroes or Mythic
Heroes, they will always earn
double the usual amount of SP
and EXP in battle.

Blessing Effects #2:
Match a Legendary Hero or
Mythic Hero, the current season's
type, and your allies' blessings to
earn a special bonus.

For example, go into battle with
the Water-type Legendary Hero
Fjorm during Water season with
Water-blessed allies to earn
a bonus of HP+3 and Spd+3.

Season Schedule:
You can check the top of the
Battle screen and other locations
for info on the current season.

Heroes have an icon on their
profile screen. Tap the icon to
check what type of Legendary
Effect or Mythic Effect they have.

when they go into battle with a

Aether Raids - Astra & Anima Season:
Allies blessed with Astra gain a boost
when they go into battle with an Astra-type
Mythic Hero.
Allies blessed with Anima gain a boost
when they go into battle with an Anima-type
Mythic Hero.

must defeat at least two foes.

Continuing:

can use a Light's Blessing or Orbs
to continue playing.

You will still need to meet the
regular victory conditions (such as
defeating two foes with the Hero
facing the ordeal) to clear the
map.

SP, HM, etc.

Pair Up:
Legendary Heroes who have the
Pair Up ability can band together
in a pair with an ally.

When the Legendary Hero who is
the lead in a pair is deployed into
battle and their cohort is not, the
two will join the battle as a group.

Pair Up - Compatible Modes:
・ Main Story
・ Paralogues
・ Training Tower
・ Allegiance Battles

Pair Up Effects 1:
Allies who are deployed as a pair
will have boosts granted to their
stats. These boosts are based on
their partner's stats.

Note: Values are detailed on the
next help page.

Pair Up Bonuses:
Atk: (Partner's Atk - 25) / 10
Spd: (Partner's Spd - 10) / 10
Def: (Partner's Def - 10) / 10
Res: (Partner's Res - 10) / 10

Note: Maximum bonus of +4 to
each stat, rounded down.

Pair Up Effects 2: Switch
The lead and cohort allies in a
Pair Up unit can be swapped
by tapping the Switch button.

This button remains active even
after the unit has moved.

More Information:
If either of the allies in a Pair Up
unit have the Sing or Dance skill,
then Sing or Dance cannot be
used on that Pair Up unit.

More Information:
・ When deployed, the cohort
cannot grant or receive Legendary
Effects.
・ Only the lead receives EXP, SP,
and HM.
・ A cohort's Support Effects will
not activate.

Idle Scouting:
Send two Heroes to scout out
other worlds in order to recover
their lore for the Heroes' Saga.

After sending Heroes out, you
have to only await their return.

Lore Recovery:
When Heroes return from scout
missions with lore, the recovery
gauge will fill, and one act of the
saga may be completed. (Strength
of the sent Heroes will not affect
the amount of lore recovered.)

Strikes:
When you have scouted enough,
the option to strike will unlock,
allowing four Heroes to be sent to
fight four foes in the other world.
Once all the foes are defeated, the
strike and the saga are complete,
and the story comes to a close.

Strike Rules:
Battles in strikes follow their own
unique set of rules. The stats of
Heroes are adjusted so that every
Hero has something to offer, even
if they are lower level or rarity.
(Critical attacks and dodges may
also occur for time to time.)

Bonus Titles:
When a Hero from a game in the
Bonus Titles list is sent out, they
offer the following benefits:
・ Recovery gauge fills faster.
・ Their stats are raised in strikes.
・ Additional lines get recorded.

Ally Support:
If support-partner allies are sent
out together, their bond will grow
slightly stronger, and they will
be granted stat bonuses during
strike missions.

Growing Crops:

be ready to harvest at the start
of the next Aether Raids season.

Dragonflowers:

Ingredients:

ingredients without using R&R
Affinity. Ingredients are used in
the Dining Hall.

Harvesting:
Tap on fully grown crops to
harvest them.

Withering Crops:
Grown crops left unharvested
will wither at the start of the
next season, and withered
crops cannot be harvested.

Be sure to pay attention when
harvest season rolls around!

Animal Goods:
You can collect foods like meat
and eggs when visiting your field
at the start of a season.

Preparing Dishes:
Prepare a dish using one to four
ingredients. Ingredients can be
harvested in your field.

Rating:
If you prepare a nice dish, it will
be rated on a scale of 1 to 5 ★s.

Rewards:
You can get rewards based on
the ★s you earn during each
reward-cycle period.

Tips & Tricks:
Dishes with more ingredients are
more likely to earn higher ratings
but are more difficult to prepare.

Including ingredients that are not
in a recipe lowers the chance of
successfully preparing a nice dish.

Secret Ingredient Bonus:
Place an ingredient in the Secret
Ingredient slot to increase the
likelihood of earning a high rating.

High-quality ingredients further
increase the likelihood of your
dish earning a high rating.

Chef's Home-Style Bonus:
In rare cases, a chef will make a
dish in the style of a particular
place (Askr-style, for example).

These dishes have a better chance
of earning a high rating.

Duo Heroes / Harmonized Heroes:
・ Duo Heroes and Harmonized
Heroes both take up two slots.
・ Heroes marked with an × will
not appear in Aether Resorts.

Glory and Tier:

start the season with an amount
of Glory based on your Tier.

Tier Thresholds:
After you've reached Tiers 4, 7,
10, and 13, you will not be
demoted to a lower Tier even if
you lose a battle after that point.

Maximizing Glory:
・ The amount of Glory lost on
a defeat is based on your Tier.
・ On a defeat, Glory lost can be
decreased with a higher score.
・ An opponent with a higher Tier
will let you to earn more Glory for
victory and lose less on a defeat.

Bonus Legendary/Mythic Heroes:
Include one of the Heroes from
the current season on your team
to ignore your first defeat (so you
can suffer a maximum of four
defeats instead of three). You also
lose less Glory when defeated,
saving you 40 Glory each defeat.

Editing Your Teams:
・Create four teams with a total
of 20 Heroes, five per team.
・Duplicate Heroes are not
allowed in your regiment.
・Each team can include only one
ally that can use Sing or Dance
and one ally with Savior.

Vetoing Teams:
・You can select two of your
opponent's four teams to veto.
They cannot be used.
・Two of your teams will also be
vetoed. Select one of your
remaining teams and battle!

Glory and Tier:
・ Your Glory will change based
on your battle results.
・ Your Tier is based on your
Glory.
・ When a new season begins,
you will start the season with
an amount of Glory based on
your Tier.

Maximizing Glory:
・ The amount of Glory lost on
a defeat is based on your Tier.
・ On a defeat, Glory lost can be
decreased with a higher score
・ An opponent with a higher Tier
will let you earn more Glory for
victory and lose less on a defeat.

Tier Thresholds:
After you've reached Tiers 4, 7,
10, and 13, you will not be
demoted to a lower Tier even if
you lose a battle after that point.

Bonus Legendary/Mythic Heroes:
Include one of the Heroes from
the current season on your team
to ignore your first defeat (so you
can suffer a maximum of four
defeats instead of three). You also
lose less Glory when defeated,
saving you 40 Glory each defeat.

Bonus Legendary/Mythic Heroes:
If just one of the bonus Legendary
or Mythic Heroes is on any of your
four teams, their bonus will take
effect.

(Whether or not the team is used
or even if it is vetoed, the bonus
will still take effect.)

Regarding Cancellation:
・ If you cancel your Feh Pass subscription,
you will still be able to access all the benefits
of a Feh Pass until they refresh.
・ You will lose access to these benefits once
your Feh Pass subscription has expired.
・ If you do not cancel automatic renewal at
least 24 hours before your subscription is set
to refresh, your Feh Pass subscription will
be automatically renewed.
・ See the FAQ for more information on how
to check the validity period of your Feh Pass
subscription or to cancel automatic renewal.

・ Your Feh Pass subscription will be renewed
automatically each month, refreshing your Feh
Pass subscription benefits, unless you cancel it
at least 24 hours before your subscription is
set to renew.
・ If you change to a new device that has a
different OS than your current device, your
subscription cannot be transferred. Please
cancel your previous subscription before
starting a subscription on the new device.
・ You can collect Resplendent Heroes by
logging in during their distribution period.
・ If you subscribe to Feh Pass near the end
of a Resplendent Hero's distribution period,
please ensure there is enough time in their
distribution period for you to collect them.

Rearmed Heroes:
Rearmed Heroes can use a
special type of skill inheritance
that differs from the inheritance
used by Heroes under typical
circumstances.

Arcane Inheritance:
In contrast with inheritance as it
usually occurs, when performing
arcane inheritance, the source ally
will not be lost (once for each
summon of a Rearmed Hero, and
the Rearmed Hero cannot create
Combat Manuals afterward).

Arcane Weapon Skills:
・ Arcane weapons are inheritable.
・ Once an arcane weapon is
inherited, it loses its ability to be
inherited via Inherit Skill.

Arcane Weapon Restrictions:
Only Rearmed Heroes can equip
both their arcane weapon and
an exclusive skill (such as Gray
Waves, etc.) other than Sing,
Dance, or Play at the same time.

Ascended Heroes - Ascended Traits:
Ascended Heroes have an Ascended Asset,
which boosts one of their stats beyond that
Hero's standard asset and flaw.
Ascendant Florets can also be used to grant
Ascended Assets to non-Ascended Heroes.
(See the Ascend Traits menu Help messages
to learn more.)

Rearmed Heroes - Pre-Inheritance:
In contrast with standard inheritance,
arcane weapon skills can be inherited
and the source ally will not be lost in
the process. This can be performed
only once for each Rearmed Hero
summoned. (See the Inherit Skills
menu Help messages to learn more.)

Rearmed Heroes - Arcane Inheritance:
In contrast with standard inheritance,
arcane weapon skills can be inherited
and the source ally will not be lost in
the process. This can be performed
only once for each Rearmed Hero
summoned. (See the Inherit Skills
menu Help messages to learn more.)

Merging Forma:
Two Forma units can be merged,
as long as both the source and
the target are Forma.
